nodes.text: The High Riddles of Dwartii were a set of riddles that shared their name with the Inner Rim's Dwartii system as well as the group of philosophers and lawgivers known as the Four Sages of Dwartii. As a means of assessment in the Trial of Insight—a Jedi Trial which sought to test one's ability to overcome illusion and discern the truth of a matter—one challenge Jedi Padawans could face was solving a High Riddle of Dwartii, without prior research of it in the Jedi Archives. At some point by 990 BBY, Chief Librarian Restelly Quist of the Jedi Order authored a chapter devoted to the Jedi Trials for the Jedi trainee guidebook The Jedi Path: A Manual for Students of the Force. In that chapter, she noted the riddles' role in the Trial of Insight.
The High Riddles of Dwartii were mentioned in The Jedi Path: A Manual for Students of the Force, a 2010 reference book written by Daniel Wallace.
